Line1: There it is. And mostly intact. They could have survived impact... but it's been years.
Line2: Looks like it was stripped after the crash. They'd have tried to get a beacon up as soon as possible.

Line1: Sell it to the volus. He'll pay.
Line2: Idiots. Who would do that to themselves?
Line3: If I don't, I wake up screaming with furniture slamming into the wall.
column8: A little snort gives you enough biotics to move a pencil around with your mind. For a little while.

Line1: You have been identified as a hostile intruder.

It is likely that searching the wreckage would provide information about the Estevanico's final hours. Warning: Disturbing the wreck could cause it to become unbalanced and fall over the cliff's edge.
Elevator en route.
Line2: Mezzanine level. Enjoy your stay.
Line3: Thank you. Which level, please?
column8: Mezzanine. Have a pleasant stay.

Line1: Eat this, you synthetic son of a bitch!
Line2: How do you like that?
Line3: For the Fleet!
column8: Burn, you bastard!

Line1: One door enabled.
Being hired is merely the beginning. You must earn your place in the mighty army we are building.
Tiredly: Frank, when you start your shift in the cargo bay, take a look around. We might have picked up stowaways at the last station.
Line2: Shepard, do you hear me? Get out of that bed now -- this facility is under attack.
Line3: There's a pistol in the locker on the other side of the room. Hurry!
column8: Shepard. Your scars aren't healed, but I need you to get moving. This facility is under attack.

Line1: Keep moving. We need to get you to the shuttles.
Line2: Don't waste time. I can't keep the mechs distracted for long.
Line3: I didn't work for two years to lose you now. Keep moving, Shepard.
column8: Being hired is merely the beginning. You must earn your place in the mighty army we are building.

Line1: There it is. And mostly intact. They could have survived impact... but it's been years.
Line2: Looks like it was stripped after the crash. They'd have tried to get a beacon up as soon as possible.
Line3: Come on! We need to get to Niket!
column8: They're on the far side of the conveyor line. Time your shots!

Line1: He looks nervous. Could be he's noticed you.
Line2: Also a possibility.
Line3: There are obstructions ahead. I'll try to go around. Don't lose him.

Line1: How could you do it, Shepard? I didn't want this. I didn't want my father's name destroyed.
Line2: My father would have wanted the Migrant Fleet to stay strong, united. The outrage, the politicking... this is going to tear my people apart.
Line3: All so that I'll be in good standing when I leave for our suicide mission!
column8: I know you were trying to help. I just... Let's get out of here.

Line1: You did it! I just got the revised contracts.
Line2: Thank you, Shepard. You've saved Zhu's Hope again.
Line3: I don't think I could have... Is it always like this? Yesterday's problems lingering in some new form? Isn't anything ever just fixed?
column8: And you could have gunned down the slaves the Thorian sent against you. That would have been easier. But you took the harder path. So will I.

Line1: The vorcha may be gone, but I still don't trust the Blue Suns. Not after what they did.
Line2: This clinic is a sanctuary; if you're looking for trouble, go somewhere else.
Line3: This is probably the safest place in the district right now. We intend to keep it that way.
column8: The Professor's got a few surprises cooked up in case the vorcha decide to attack the clinic.

Line1: The emergency floor lighting will guide you, Mr. Moreau.
Line2: Propulsion systems are disabled. I'm detecting a virus in the ship's computers.
Line3: Primary defense systems are offline. We can save the Normandy, Mr. Moreau, but you must help me.
column8: Give me the ship.

Line1: Aye, aye.
Docking area power restored.
Line2: Intruders are requested to report to the cargo doors for immediate removal from station.

Line1: Intruder detected. You are not authorized to be in this area.
Line2: Archangel!
Line3: You think you can screw with the Blue Suns!
column8: This ends now!

Line1: There it is. And mostly intact. They could have survived impact... but it's been years.
Line2: Looks like it was stripped after the crash. They'd have tried to get a beacon up as soon as possible.

Line1: Trespassers are topside! Tell Jedore we can't hold them and the krogan! We're getting slaughtered!
Research area power restored.
Line2: Beam engaged. Testing area has been locked down according to protocol M29-2.
Line3: Our system has your shipped flagged as Cerberus. Verify.
column8: Permission granted. Welcome home, Tali'Zorah.

Line1: There it is. And mostly intact. They could have survived impact... but it's been years.
Line2: Looks like it was stripped after the crash. They'd have tried to get a beacon up as soon as possible.
Line3: Being hired is merely the beginning. You must earn your place in the mighty army we are building.

Line1: Hub area power restored.
Line2: Central mainframe access granted.
Line3: Warning, life support failure imminent. Recommend immediate docking at a space facility for repairs.
column8: Main drive failure. Auxiliary systems failure. Mass effect core systems failure. Structural integrity failing.

Line1: Three doors enabled.
There it is. And mostly intact. They could have survived impact... but it's been years.
Line2: Looks like it was stripped after the crash. They'd have tried to get a beacon up as soon as possible.

Line1: To access the Technical Laboratory, a scientist such as Dr. Mordin Solus must be present.
Line2: The port observation deck is closed until needed.
Line3: The starboard observation deck is closed until needed.
column8: A Gunnery Officer is required to access the Gunnery Control Station.

Line1: This place is supposed to be empty. Who the fuck shot that varren? It's a fresh kill.
Welcome back! Just so you know, your discount is still good, and I'll let you know about any special items that might hold your interest.
Line2: Parasini? Hell! Thanks for the warning.
Line3: I'm going to get lost and remove some evidence. I'll program the kiosk to offer you a discount, though.
column8: Where the hell am I going to go next, Omega?

Line1: All intruders intentionally violating quarantine are requested to exit the station immediately.
Line2: Come on! We need to get to Niket!
Line3: They're on the far side of the conveyor line. Time your shots!
column8: Damn it! I'm not letting her get Oriana.

Line1: Shepard, you've recently been dead.
Line2: Don't you deserve the quality and distinction of a traditional asari burial robe?
Line3: Anatass Mortuary offers the finest quality burial robes, hand-spun by skilled asari artisans.
column8: Anatass. We'll help you leave a good-looking corpse.

Line1: Shepard, are you looking to continue your education?
Line2: It's one thing to know how to shoot a gun...
Line3: But do you have the career skills to deploy and manage today's high tech network infrastructures?
column8: The Henley Technical Institute can help. Courses available through our extranet site will put you on the path to success.

Line1: You're really holding out on me? I'm a man on the edge! I've got nothing to lose!
Line2: I'll do anything to get the job done! I'll go all the way without a second thought!
Line3: I'm going to save the galaxy! I don't have time for your crap!
column8: I'm Commander Shepard's squad mate! Practically second-in-command! You don't want to mess with me!

Line1: Ungh... think I broke a rib. All of them.
Krogan took down the grid! We're blind and getting hit on all sides! Where are the heavies?
Line2: Krogan on our six! Copy, god damn it! Where's Jedore and her personal guard?
Line3: Concentrate on the krogan charge, or we're all dead! Who was the genius who gave them arms?
column8: Berserkers are going down, but the outsider commandoes are still incoming! Repeat, still incoming!

Line1: Come on! We need to get to Niket!
Line2: They're on the far side of the conveyor line. Time your shots!
Line3: Damn it! I'm not letting her get Oriana.
column8: We can cut down through the cargo line!

Line1: There is no escape, human.
Line2: You must die so that we may live.
Line3: Your extinction is inevitable.
column8: The cycle cannot be broken.

Line1: Five doors enabled.
If you're ready, let's go to your ship now.
Line2: Take your time. I'll be ready whenever you are.
Line3: My mother's corpse is lying in my living room. While I understand why you might want to go through my panty drawer, perhaps we can hurry?
column8: This is going to be fun.

Line1: To access the Technical Laboratory, a scientist such as Dr. Mordin Solus must be present.
Line2: The port observation deck is closed until needed.
Line3: The starboard observation deck is closed until needed.
column8: A Gunnery Officer is required to access the Gunnery Control Station.

Line1: Reflective armor prototype repositioned.
I don't care what you do, no one gets across that bridge.
Line2: Blow the damn thing up if you have to.
Line3: What the hell are you waiting for? Just kill them!
column8: Damn it! Finish them off!

Line1: Maintenance area power restored.
Line2: Krogan took down the grid! We're blind and getting hit on all sides! Where are the heavies?
Line3: Krogan on our six! Copy, god damn it! Where's Jedore and her personal guard?
column8: Concentrate on the krogan charge, or we're all dead! Who was the genius who gave them arms?

Line1: With the vorcha gone, the Blue Suns should be able to regain control of the district. Things can get back to normal.
Line2: On our way here, we saw humans looting the apartments of the dead. It made me sick.
Line3: I didn't realize how good things were in the district before the quarantine. Never thought I'd miss the Blue Suns.
column8: I didn't think this clinic would be crawling with so many of your kind. I would have thought twice about coming here.

Line1: The fog on the planet's surface is interfering with your navigation. The nearby beacon towers may serve as a navigational contingency.
Line2: We're in space -- they have nowhere to go, and they know it.
Line3: But still, we exercise extreme caution. These are dangerous individuals.
column8: We have many ways to control the population.

Line1: Krogan took down the grid! We're blind and getting hit on all sides! Where are the heavies?
Line2: Krogan on our six! Copy, god damn it! Where's Jedore and her personal guard?
Line3: Concentrate on the krogan charge, or we're all dead! Who was the genius who gave them arms?
column8: Berserkers are going down, but the outsider commandoes are still incoming! Repeat, still incoming!

Line1: Grab the pistol from the locker.
Line2: You don't have time to wait around, Shepard! Grab your weapon!
Line3: Focus, Shepard! Get the pistol from the locker.
column8: Grab the pistol and armor from the locker.

Line1: Plasma venting in progress. Attempting to reach the maintenance controls will most likely result in serious injury or death.
Line2: Being hired is merely the beginning. You must earn your place in the mighty army we are building.

Line1: Human, you've changed nothing.
Line2: Your species has the attention of those infinitely your greater.
Line3: That which you know as Reapers are your salvation through destruction.
column8: You will surrender your potential against the growing void.

Line1: This console might have something. Most of the data is corrupted, but a few bits are left.
Line2: They were performing experiments on geth systems, looking for new ways to overcome geth resistance to reprogramming.
Line3: No. Father just told me to send back any geth technology I could find that wasn't a direct danger to the Fleet.
column8: I suspected he might be testing weapons, but I thought he was just working on new ways to bypass shields or armor.

Line1: Come on! We need to get to Niket!
Line2: They're on the far side of the conveyor line. Time your shots!
Line3: Damn it! I'm not letting her get Oriana.
column8: We can cut down through the cargo line!

Line1: There is a high probability that you or your equipment will infect the station. This cannot be allowed to happen.
To access the Technical Laboratory, a scientist such as Dr. Mordin Solus must be present.
Line2: The port observation deck is closed until needed.
Line3: The starboard observation deck is closed until needed.
column8: A Gunnery Officer is required to access the Gunnery Control Station.

Line1: Keep moving. We need to get you to the shuttles.
Line2: Don't waste time. I can't keep the mechs distracted for long.
Line3: I didn't work for two years to lose you now. Keep moving, Shepard.

Line1: This clinic gave me sanctuary during the plague. I'll see if they need my help.
Line2: Mordin saved my life. I owe him everything.
Line3: Mordin says you humans aren't to blame for the plague. But why aren't your kind getting sick?
column8: Not all humans are bad. The volunteers here have been very good to me.

Line1: We'll hold it off as long as we can.
Line2: Aaah!
Line3: Being hired is merely the beginning. You must earn your place in the mighty army we are building.

Line1: Come on! We need to get to Niket!
Line2: They're on the far side of the conveyor line. Time your shots!
Line3: Damn it! I'm not letting her get Oriana.
column8: We can cut down through the cargo line!

Line1: Commencing shutdown.
Line2: Obstruction detected.
Line3: Shutter secured.

Line1: All attempts to decontaminate station have failed. Require more power to escalate defenses.
Come on! We need to get to Niket!
Line2: They're on the far side of the conveyor line. Time your shots!
Line3: Damn it! I'm not letting her get Oriana.
column8: We can cut down through the cargo line!

Line1: Grr!
Hurry! Get to the door! Run!
Line2: You'll have to be quicker than that, Shepard. The door will only stay open for a few seconds.
Line3: Activate the console to unlock the door, then run through before it closes.
column8: I can't override the security lock on the door remotely. You'll have to do it.

Line1: This is a secure zone. Please leave this station immediately.
Line2: Oh my god! What is that?
Line3: Aaah!

Line1: The blast took out the mechs, but you're not safe there. Head into the next room.
Line2: Lock in another thermal clip, Shepard.
Line3: Someone's hacking security trying to kill you. Look for a thermal clip for your pistol.
column8: Find a thermal clip and get moving.

Line1: Hurry, Joker! Go!
Line2: You're our only shot! Joker, go!
Line3: Move it, Joker! You gotta go!
column8: Joker, don't waste this chance! Go!

Line1: You again. I thought I made myself clear. The terms of my contracts with the colonists from Zhu's Hope will not change.
Line2: If the humans will not hold to the terms they agreed to, they must prepare to face the consequences.
Line3: You ignorant yokel. I was negotiating contracts when your ancestors were still burning witches and enslaving each other.
column8: I haven't lost a contract dispute in 70 years. Try me.

Line1: There it is. And mostly intact. They could have survived impact... but it's been years.
Line2: Looks like it was stripped after the crash. They'd have tried to get a beacon up as soon as possible.

Line1: Clan Weyrloc should have known better. Now they face the might of the Urdnot!
Line2: Watch it, human.
Line3: Eyes straight ahead.
column8: Give me a reason.

Line1: Attention all personnel. A hostile presence has been detected. Please do not interfere with defense procedures.
Line2: We don't need any reinforcements.
Line3: It's under control. I'll go down there myself.
column8: I'll take care of it.

Line1: Our problems-- they aren't something I can fix with a few words. We'll keep talking, see what happens.
Line2: Thank you, Captain.
Line3: You'd stand up for him? Why?

Line1: No, she won't even talk to me.
Line2: I don't know. She really has it in for humans. That might explain the damn contract.

Line1: There is no escape, human.
Line2: You must die so that we may live.
Line3: Your extinction is inevitable.
column8: The cycle cannot be broken.

Line1: Look around, Shepard. Anything could be informative.
Line2: I've been investigating. This is the mother of the last victim. Speak to her; I will listen.
Line3: You are no longer relevant.
column8: This form is redundant.

Line1: I regret to inform you that all attempts to defend the station have failed. Shutting down security protocols.
Over here! Get to cover!
All doors disabled.
There it is. And mostly intact. They could have survived impact... but it's been years.
Line2: Looks like it was stripped after the crash. They'd have tried to get a beacon up as soon as possible.

Line1: Damn it, Shepard, I trusted you! I trusted you, and you screwed me over!
Line2: Again I ask for your help, and again you screw me over. I don't know why I bother.
Line3: Hermia is going to be a very poor woman very shortly. Thanks for the help, Shepard.
column8: I love nailing asari. So ageless and superior -- then you get them, and they squeal like schoolgirls.

Line1: Being hired is merely the beginning. You must earn your place in the mighty army we are building.
Line2: Shepard!
Line3: No! Help! Help me!

Line1: Commander Shepard has been recovered.
Line2: The Lazarus Project will proceed as planned.

Line1: This place is supposed to be empty. Who the fuck shot that varren? It's a fresh kill.
Look out.
Line2: He's with Archangel!
Line3: She's with Archangel!

Line1: Thank you for agreeing to take back the Alarei, Shepard. The admirals sound sure that my father is already dead, but...
Line2: I don't know. We won't know anything until we get there.
Line3: I knew this would be bad, but I guess you're never really prepared to be charged with treason.
column8: And my father... I don't know. He could still be alive. They don't know for certain that he's dead. I just don't know, Shepard. And I need to find out.

Line1: Testing area has been unlocked.
Line2: All personnel, take this opportunity to leave the station immediately.
Line3: Being hired is merely the beginning. You must earn your place in the mighty army we are building.

Line1: Living area power restored.
Line2: The living area doors have been closed to quarantine a threat to this station. Advise intruders to engage self-destruct procedures to avoid death by starvation.

Line1: Docked vessel detected. Attempting to upload central programming into docked vessel's mainframe.
Line2: For increased tactical control, hold the Right Shoulder button to bring up the Power Wheel.
Line3: This pauses the action, giving you time to evaluate the battlefield, target new enemies, or select a power.
column8: While an enemy is targeted, highlight a power using the Left Thumbstick and press A.

Line1: No, I haven't had any luck yet. She insists it was legal.
Line2: I don't know. I'm going to call in a favor and have a friend examine the contract.

Line1: Good luck talking to the weapons merchant! Remember, she's at the shop by the carport!
Line2: You want to see how far I'll go? I learned how to shove a gun in people's faces from--
Line3: ...Commander Shepard?
column8: Shepard? Is it really you? It's me, Conrad Verner! We met on the Citadel? I wanted to become a Spectre?

Line1: Warning, life support failure imminent. Recommend immediate docking at a space facility for repairs.
Line2: Main drive failure. Auxiliary systems failure. Mass effect core systems failure. Structural integrity failing.
Line3: The hull has been breached in Sectors 12, 14, and 30. No survivors.
column8: Warning: power plant damage has led to overload. Core systems failure imminent.

Line1: Tremble and die, offworld scum! I am Weyrloc Guld, Chief of Chiefs!
Line2: Our ancestors will take your blood as tribute!
Line3: Clan Weyrloc will never be defeated! Feel the blood rage!
column8: The Weyrloc will... never fall...

Line1: This is a database. It contains a portion of the heretics' accumulated memories.
Line2: Wait. We discovered copies of our current patrol routes in this database.
Line3: This suggests the heretics have runtimes within our networks.
column8: You do not understand. Organics do not know each other's minds. Geth do. We are not suspicious. We accept each other.

Line1: I just received the revised contracts.
Line2: Thank you, Shepard. Zhu's Hope is in your debt yet again.
Line3: Thank you, Shepard. I don't know what we would have done without you.
column8: Let me know if you have any luck with that Baria Frontiers woman.

Line1: Two doors enabled.
Line2: Hostiles approaching. Immediate withdrawal is advised.
Line3: The maintenance shaft is located at the far end of the science lab.

Line1: The weapons merchant said that we took care of the red sand dealers! I guess I really helped!
Line2: I didn't know. I... I can't risk you being worried about my safety.
Line3: I'll stop pretending to be something I'm not. But thanks for letting me help, at least for a little while.
column8: It's really good to have you back.

Line1: Datamine and analysis complete.
Line2: Shepard-Commander. It is time to choose. Do we rewrite the heretics, or delete them?
Line3: We are conflicted. There is no consensus among our higher-order runtimes: 573 favor rewrite, and 571 favor destruction.
column8: Shepard-Commander. You have fought the heretics. You have perspective we lack. The geth grant their fate to you.

Line1: I am detecting a large power source inside the base. It is probable that destroying it would disrupt the entire facility.
Sometimes I dream that I'm back in this bed being tortured. I used to tie the sheets around my wrists and try to rip them off.
Line2: I want to stop coming back here.
Line3: Okay, no more wallowing. Let's blow this place to hell.
column8: There's a few more things I want to see. This place is the same, but so different.

Line1: Human, you've changed nothing.
Line2: Your species has the attention of those infinitely your greater.
Line3: That which you know as Reapers are your salvation through destruction.
column8: You will surrender your potential against the growing void.

Line1: Please exercise caution when rotating the reflective armor prototypes. Vital lab equipment may be damaged.
Normandy to shore party. We are inbound to your location.
Line2: Hang on, folks.

Line1: There have been four fatalities on this station in the last week. Remember, safety is everyone's responsibility.
Line2: Come on! We need to get to Niket!
Line3: They're on the far side of the conveyor line. Time your shots!
column8: Damn it! I'm not letting her get Oriana.

Line1: This is one of the storage units I sent to Father.
Line2: Looks like parts from a disabled repair drone, plus a reflex algorithm that I didn't recognize. I got this on Haestrom.
Line3: These suits have more pockets than you'd think. Quarians have learned how to salvage whatever we can whenever we can.
column8: Within reason. We're not vorcha. But we repair what most people would throw away.
